Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: This is a great Hotel if i come to Amsterdam again i stay at this hotel............thanks it was very great. The diffrent rooms a really cool

Reviews.Title: “Trip to Amsterdam for a Conference”
Reviews.Author: Giancarlo P
Reviews.Content: Rooms are small but confortable and clean, the bathroom are also confortable and clean, very central position, close to DAM square and 5 min walking from the Central Station.

Reviews.Title: “Simple (but interesting) rooms in a very central location”
Reviews.Author: revolt
Reviews.Content: The rooms are simple but very clean and with all the essentials. Some of them can be quite interesting since they've been decorated by local artists. Staff is professional and friendly and you can have very good breakfasts in the bar next door. It's located very close to Dam Square and to the central station (2 minutes on foot to reach both). Beds are super comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Stylish, basic and centrally located”
Reviews.Author: Hatsumura
Reviews.Content: Trendy hotel with a nice concept. The location is great, close to the Dam, the Centraal and the Red Light district. It has an elevator - which is definitely a plus in central A'dam. The entrance is a bit difficult to find, since it's just a door (we used the kebab place beside as a point of reference). Each room is unique and has been decorated by fashion students. We booked a 1-star room for one night and, since all were occupied, we were upgraded to a 3-star. The room itself was very basic and small, with no minibar and few amenities, but quiet (facing the back) and clean. Some people may not like the decor though. Ours had the walls totally covered with pink fabric and black ribbons. It was a bit dark and claustrophobic but it seems that there are rooms with a nice feel.

Reviews.Title: “very nice place to stay for a short time”
Reviews.Author: nilsvdburg
Reviews.Content: If you are travelling to Amsterdam and just want a normal room with bed and bathroom this place is really good, the staff is friendly and the installations are good. The room is small, but por 2 people just staying a few days it was perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice!”
Reviews.Author: Tania_Liliana
Reviews.Content: The best staff, they took care of everything for us. Nice, modern and interesting rooms. I would love to stay there again. Thank you

Reviews.Title: “perfect location and size”
Reviews.Author: Andy B
Reviews.Content: interesting decoration, superb bed and perfect location staff was exeselent slightly overpriced as for Easter, but I would still book it if I was going for another short trip here

Reviews.Title: “Great but small...”
Reviews.Author: Thomaz G
Reviews.Content: Great stay. Small rooms, but not a problem since we only slept there... Good central location. Extremely comfy beds! Very nice staff - took care of all our needs. Perfect for the globetrotter used to city centre location vs spacious high street hotel dilemma... ;-)

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: JLAU0517
Reviews.Content: Besides nice staff, the hotel is clean and have good location. I love this hotel as it is totally different from regular hotel. Not just providing a place for stay, the feeling of DESIGN is so strong. The only drawback is the shower. It is not strong enough.

Reviews.Title: “very "unique" hotel room”
Reviews.Author: david r
Reviews.Content: very nice and romantic room. ( 320 ) within 5 minutes walk from central station great value overall clean easy check-in/check-out only bad thing, the only window faces a wall, if you suffer from claustrophobia you might dislike your stay.

Reviews.Title: “Not what expected”
Reviews.Author: tarah4011
Reviews.Content: The location was good. I complained about the first room as I thought there was a safety hazard as there was a visible extension lead going running from one wall to the next that you could of tripped over. Second room was ok but had a damp smell, bathroom was lovely. On the website it said there were tea making facilities but there wasn't it isn't offered at all in the hotel. Hotel wasn't finished there was still work going on.

Reviews.Title: “A comfy stay”
Reviews.Author: HonestHull
Reviews.Content: We have just had a city break staying at this hotel, we were staying in the "Mattress room" which is on the top floor with a balcony. First impressions are how do you get a room to look like this using recycled materials and yet still retain the special feel that the guests look for. They have captured everything that a traqvveler looks for in a very eco friendly manner and we would certainly recommend the hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Funky hotel”
Reviews.Author: Katiejh
Reviews.Content: We booked to stay in one of the 1 star rooms which I found a little expensive at â‚¬90 per night. We arrived early and were allowed to check in and the receptionist gave us an upgrade to 2 star. The room was lovely, very small but fine for a couple of nights. The bathroom was very nice and very clean. Free wifi in the hotel and great location.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay in this "Art Hotel"”
Reviews.Author: Smiiidg3
Reviews.Content: Stayed 21st - 24th March as a Young couple. This hotel is in a fantastic location, situated a 2 minute walk from the station, it was very easy to find as it is on the main road 'Damrak'. It is also close to the red light district and is within walking distance of pretty much the rest of Amsterdam city. I was nervous about staying here after seeing mixed reviews but as soon as we got to the reception, all my fears were put to ease. We were greeted by very friendly staff who we layer discovered were willing to help out with even the silliest of requests. The hotel has small lifts, but these are dressed to impress with stitched fabric walls and they lead out onto either beautiful waiting areas or the room corridors. There are also little wooden staircases if you don't want to keep waiting around for the lift. Inside our room was fantastic, we had the one decorated "manray's eyes" which involved circular frames on the walls with an eye print in each. The bed was the most comfortable thing I have ever slept in and the room was simple but spotless. There is an electronic safe in the room so we could keep our passports and money secured. The bathroom is a simple wet room and the cleaning staff are very willing to give you new soap or toilet roll even if you've only used it once! My only criticism, and it is a small one, is the cafe downstairs only accept debit card so if you want to eat there, don't bother trying to pay with cash as they won't let you. Overall it was a fantastically comfortable stay and I will be booking this hotel again in the near future!

Reviews.Title: “Surprisingly nice, given the mixed reviews”
Reviews.Author: paulinlim
Reviews.Content: I loved our bedding, very fluffy and comfortable. The decor was eccentric but not unpleasant, and impeccably clean. The attached restaurant and store were chic, hip and airy. We didn't have problems with noise until the final night, when someone kept slamming a door nearby. Our room didn't face the busy street; that might explain the peacefulness. It was very clean, and they graciously let us store food in their refrigerator, although because of a misunderstanding, some employee(s) ate some of our fruit the first night, but the attendant kindly replaced the fruit. The towels were nice and I loved the towel heater, but they should provide washcloths, too. Our door didn't close all the way without a good push, and once we came back and found the door left ajar by the cleaning staff; luckily, nothing had been stolen. I thought this hotel was very good value.

Reviews.Title: “Very disappointed in 'The Exchange' hotel”
Reviews.Author: TLWhite
Reviews.Content: This is the first time I have been let down by tripadvisor reviews. We were thoroughly disappointed in our stay at The Exchange and felt more like we were staying in a hostel versus the supposed 4 star room we paid for. The check in process went smoothly and the girl attending the desk was quite friendly and efficient. We arrived around 1pm and she found a room that would sleep the 3 of us and was available for check in a bit early. She asked if a king size bed would be suitable for us (2 adults and our 8 year old daughter) and we said yes, no problem (we didn't realize that the problem would be staying on the 2nd floor overlooking perhaps the busiest street in all of Amsterdam- we wished that she would've thought of that). We walked up the dingy and rickety stair case to our room. After reading about this hotel for weeks and studying all of the different room designs we had high hopes for a cool room. Our room was basically just the 'fabric room' with curtains on all 4 walls (pictures attached). The king size bed was nice and comfortable. The small rack with 6 hangers for our clothes was fine. I knew there wouldn't be a blow dryer or an iron which again was fine with us. The bathroom was quite basic, something you'd likely find in a hostel or college dorm room. No kleenex (tissue) or wash cloths and one miniscule light above the sink, but the worst thing was the horrible sewer smell coming up through one of the drains. As you'll see in the photos attached, our second room floor was directly above the Doner fast food restaurant. We didn't think any of this would be a problem or we would've asked for a different room. Upon arrival in the afternoon the noise level, food smell and sewer smell weren't apparent. It wasn't until we got into bed early (5am wake up call for train to airport), that the sounds of loud tourists and the metro rail (on the street just below us) filled our ears and the smells of greasy fast food and sewer permeated our room, and at that point it was too late to do anything. Overall the room prices don't quite jive with the target age for this hotel. If you're a college student coming to Amsterdam to party and you have a luxury hotel budget then this hotel is likely for you. Luckily this didn't dampen our trip as we loved Amsterdam and Bruges and had fabulous hotel experiences outside of this.

Reviews.Title: “A great concept in the perfect location”
Reviews.Author: UrbanArtisan
Reviews.Content: This is a great little hotel with lovely staff, all situated in the perfect location - only 5 minutes walk from the train station and right on Damrak. There are lovely design features all over the hotel, giving it a trendy, artsy feel. I stayed in a budget room that may be a little simple for some, but it still has all you need, everything is super clean, it all feels new and the beds are really comfortable. There are no eating facilities in the hotel itself but there is a cafe next door that is run by the same people... and also a groovy little shop next to that with all kinds of products made by Dutch designers and also a Sushi restaurant downstairs. This is why the Exchange should be seen as a whole concept that is trying to do something a little different from other hotels in Amsterdam. And better still, you don't have to be super-rich to stay there but the super-rich should still enjoy the unique environment.

Reviews.Title: “great!!”
Reviews.Author: CDM123456
Reviews.Content: clean, well designed rooms! Service very smily ! Rooms looks like very nice! We enjoyed our stay ! rooms at 1st florr a little noisy from the street, but not too late. Beds very comfortable

Reviews.Title: “review Hotel The Exchange - February 2012”
Reviews.Author: NielsV01
Reviews.Content: It was a pleasant stay at the nice design hotel. It is a new hotel, so some things have to be done still, but not mayor things. It all looks nice and the location is marvelous, right in the centre. We really enjoyed our stay.

Reviews.Title: “trendy, surprising hot spot in central Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: winningspirits
Reviews.Content: a unique hotel! You can choose your own number of "stars" rating. That varies per room. All the rooms are unique decorated and offer good to excellent comfort. A very trendy fashion hot spot. very near all famous "must do's" in Amsterdam. Good breakfast and a very nice shop complete your stay in this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Funky, comfortable, good location”
Reviews.Author: TaraTours
Reviews.Content: The hotel is situated in a great location, on the Damrak with the Central Station at one end and Dam Square at the other, so it's really easy to walk everywhere. The bedroom was really funky, very modern with cool decoration taking over one wall. The hanging space was minimalist to say the least though, as the 'wardrobe' only had 3 hangers, so lucky we were only staying two nights! The room was spotless and very spacious. The shower was excellent and the beds were very very comfy. All staff were courteous and polite. I would recommend this hotel if you're in amsterdam for a fun weekend and want to be located closely to the centre - beware if you're a light sleeper though as the trams and traffic outside were quite audible!

Reviews.Title: “A quiet haven in the busy centre of Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: Mleine
Reviews.Content: The main street opposite the central station of Amsterdam is a street I usually avoid. But now Iâ€™ve fund a quiet haven between the ugly tourist-trap restaurants and ticket counters. The door of the hotel The Exchange is hard to find, you really need the address: Damrak 50. A narrow hallway leads to a hidden gem, a fantastic design hotel with amazing rooms â€“ all decorated by students of the Amsterdam Fashion Institute. It is not a huge hotel with a fancy lobby, but a special treat to those who love the combination of old houses, 2-3 step staircases that lead to yet another floor and modern surprise- interiors. An elevator is available to almost all floors. Room 321 is spacious and covered with prints of magazines, wall to ceiling. Room 322 is a bit smaller but very romantic in a light grey color and white paper-flowers all over the walls and ceiling. A healthy breakfast is available at the restaurant next doorâ€™s, named Stock. A beauty in design and with delicious treats. Donâ€™t forget to check the interior design & gift store next doorâ€™s, named Options. All 3 are from the same family and a welcome addition to the Damrak.

Reviews.Title: “fab apart from expensive coffee and broken bed”
Reviews.Author: Gemma W Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: I would have given this hotel 5 stars for all aspects however I think that some coffee making facilities should have been provided. The coffee shop/cafe next door was very expensive and only accepted cards?! Also the bed in my room was broken.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, clean and frendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Norwegian38
Reviews.Content: Came late to the hotel and was upgraded to three star accommodation. Exciting desig for urban people. If you want a tradisjonert and boring hotels this hotel is not the place for you. I'll be back.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Fun Rooms”
Reviews.Author: meganmckean
Reviews.Content: We booked our stay at The Exchange for 2 nights as part of their 50% off opening promotion. We were in a '2 Star Comfort' room which was covered entirely in a mauve fabric, ruffled down the walls. The lighting for the room came from 4 beaded chandeliers, which gave a warm feeling to the room.The bed was huge and comfortable and took up most of the room. The bathroom had an open shower, and always had clean towels and shampoo. The common areas were interesting as well, with a sewing machine set up for use, and winding staircases that linked to each floor, making every level feel like a maze. The staff were friendly and helpful, providing a map of Amsterdam when we arrived. The cafe and store located next door were also interesting, stocked with a variety of design items. The location is fantastic, right on the Damrak. It was easy to find from Amsterdam-Centraal train station, and made getting around the city very simple. It was also handy to have the hotel located so centrally, as we could come back for a break from the cold throughout the day. Overall really enjoyed our 3 nights at The Exchange. A great place, great location and would stay here again, but probably not worth more than we paid with the 50% discount.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: ElleLuB
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel back in November and were slightly put off after reading the reviews from when it opened in December. However, after our 4 night stay we couldn't have been more happy with the hotel and their staff. . The hotel's central location on Damrak made it very easy to find and also handy if you wanted to nip back for an hour or 2 after sightseeing all day. The hotel's communal areas were clean, quirky and warm (in January Amsterdam is freezing!). Although there's no breakfast available with the hotel there is the juice bar below, however if its not your thing or if you prefer to use your cash (they only accept cards in the Exchange Hotel/Shop/Cafe) then there are lots of places nearby to grab a pastry and a coffee. We stayed in a 3 star room designed with the theme "Living in a cardboard box". Although the design made the room feel quite dark, we found it very cosy and quirky. The room itself was a fair size with a large, very comfortable bed. As the room was lined with fabric it took us a few moments to find the wardrobe which was concealed behind the door but included a stool, a safe and a few coat hangers. The bathroom was a wet room which always had hot water and clean towels. Both the bedroom and bathroom were spotless and were cleaned daily. Hair dryers are available, you just have to ask reception and they'll bring you one up straight away. The staff were extremely helpful, I lost the room key on the second night which they replaced straight away at 3.30am. A girl from reception actually let me and boyfriend look at some of the other rooms as we were really curious to see the designs. Tea and coffee facilities would be a nice extra to have in the rooms but not essential as there are hundreds of lovely cafe's around. All in all, we had a fantastic stay and would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, in great location”
Reviews.Author: nikkig257
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed this hotel as it is brand new. Therefore, the bed is great, and lovely areas in the hotel. However, there is no cafe/restaurant (the one downstairs is an expensive juice bar). Note also the whole place (cafe and hotel) only excepts debit card, or credit card with pin only so be aware (NO cash)! There are also very steep stairs, or a very small lift only so access for some people could be an issue. Lastly, no coffee/tea facilities- but the reception staff were happy to give us hot water. Overall, good place and location, but I wouldnt pay full price (we had a 50%opening discount).

Reviews.Title: “Love this Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Aine M
Reviews.Content: This hotel was brilliant. We literally stepped right off the train and into the hotel which was right in the middle of the main street. The hotel receptionist was extremely friendly and, when we were checking in, we were informed that we had been upgraded from a one star to a two star room. Upon making our way through to our room, we couldnt help but notice how stylish and sleek everything was. Most of the walls were made from glass, and the elevators had a really funky design. Our bedroom was really stylish, and exceptionally clean too. We had a flat screen tv, a superblt comfortable bed, and a safe. The bathroom was a really nice wet room. The cleaners came an changed beds etc. every day and although there is not a lot of storage space, we were provided with hangers etc for our coats. The cafe downstairs didnt accept cash, however the breakfast there was lovely as crossants and other pastries and smoothies were provided. There's nothing really bad that I could say about staying here. Perhaps the room could have been a bit more cosy with a rug (the floor was covered in linoleum), but nothing big apart from that.

Reviews.Title: “Going the extra mile”
Reviews.Author: Esmeralda1982
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed there last weekend. We were already very pleased with the interior design, its originality and how everything felt easy and comfortable thanks to an efficient and highly amiable staff. Mostly we are grateful for the extra help they provided on securing our parking discount. The receptionist came all the way to the parking with us, in order to resolve the problems we'd encountered. Most places would have just made a call. That is priceless.

Reviews.Title: “Such a cool hotel, brilliant location”
Reviews.Author: Smileygirl1968
Reviews.Content: I booked to stay at the exchange for a short break between Christmas and New Year. I'd got a fantastic price as I'd booked before the hotel had opened (opened 3rd Dec) and I was so pleased I did. The hotel is a stones throw from Central station and very easy to find. The young lady on reception was wonderfully warm and professional. We were even allowed to have our room at 10am rather than wait for the official 3pm check in. I'd booked the smallest cheapest room they had and it was blooming lovely! It was small but the bed was huge and suprembly comfortable. The decor was very cool, the fittings were all very good quality and the ensuite shower room was beautiful a wet room. And it was immaculate. The little cafe attached to the hotel is also to be recommened, but they don't take cash weirdly. They do great coffee, fresh wheat grass, freshly squeezed orange juice, fresh pastries, all really beautiful and terrific service to boot. So, if you want a romantic get away in a proper authentic Amsterdam building with style (if not space) then you'll love it. Its not a faceless chain, its quirky and high quality. I loved it.......

Reviews.Title: “Modern and fresh”
Reviews.Author: TravelBenz_11
Reviews.Content: Are new years stay at this hotel was more than a pleasant surprise. Lots of bad reviews I can see but no complaints from me. Staff very helpful and room impressive very modern and artistic.

Reviews.Title: “total rip off”
Reviews.Author: nellyjWicklow
Reviews.Content: we booked this hotel because we thought it would be new and a little different and also because of a 50% discount!!we didnt expect a room that had a double bed shoved against the wall and if the bathroom door was open u had to walk on the bed to pass it,the room was 3 star but i have stayed in better hostels.The health and safety non exsistant wires running across the floor,absolutely nowhere to hang a coat,put a cup down,put your clothes or belongings.The whole hotel put together with no thought at all to practicality.My clothes remained in my bag for two days,it was raining heavily during our stay and we had to just leave our wet coats on the floor.Our room was on the 5th floor and the lift was out of action so tracking up the numerous narrow stairs was no joke...This hotel is below standard and the only thing it has going for it is clean as it is new and pillows and bed very comfy but it will never get the prices they expect when completed.As for design pre school kids would have done a better job,a few bits of crumpled a4 paper and wool dont suffice as great design.finally dont expect a wholesome meal in the hotel restaurant,its a juice bar which you have to leave the hotel and access through another entrance.We travelled with a group of 8 others who all were sorely dissappointed with this hotel and who wont be going back.

Reviews.Title: “Less than expected”
Reviews.Author: mr_vodoo
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel because it was at 50 % (very expensive anyway), and apparently it was a very new and trendy hotel. Don't let the pictures fool you, the hotel is very very small, the entrance is about 50 cm wide and the rooms very small. Still in construction so you will be awakened by the hammers... Just too expensive for what they offer. Just very well located, near to the central station and close to the dam square

Reviews.Title: “Not a good stay!”
Reviews.Author: conorourke1
Reviews.Content: We arrived to the hotel as a building site. As the hotel was only open a week they were still "finishing" it. On arrival our room was not ready. The rooms looked nothing like they were displayed on the website. We stayed in a three star room. No where to place your items. No welcome pack, the room wasn't properly wired. We had an extension cord running across the room to the tv. No space in the room itself. No place to put clothes ect. It was not a practical room. There was also a charge of â‚¬50 which was added to our credit card. I don't know why this was in place. There was no minibar ect and they would only accept cards and no cash even in the coffeeshop next door. There was no space between the sink and the toilet which was impossible to use. Modern, idealistic and amazing it was not! It also was not worth the price we paid for. We got the room on offer as it had just opened but if people paid full price it would be extortion. I would not stay in this hotel again!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely staff, location and rooms”
Reviews.Author: itwilldo
Reviews.Content: The hotel was still under going construction work, which was understandable as it had only been open 6 days. The Hotel staff were very friendly and helpful in a excellent location down from train station and two minute walk to dam square at the other end of the road . I stayed in the 1- star room which was very nice with good decor, room was not massive but very comfortable. Next to the hotel had a cafe and its own shop.

Reviews.Title: “Unique stay!”
Reviews.Author: Silvia P
Reviews.Content: Brand new fashion inspired hotel with a perfect position just 5 minute walk from central station! Very nice people, creative and playful environment, clean room and very good breakfast, interesting selection of contemporary design pieces in the Options store too! What else??!! ;) A unique stay for curious young travellers!

Reviews.Title: “Disastrous stay in Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: Eddie C
Reviews.Content: Booked into this hotel last Thursday at a special discount rate of 50% which was because it was just open. Informed by reception when we left that the discount was because the hotel wasn't finished, informed them they shouldn't have opened. On arrival we were met by the noise of hammers and saws. Got to the room, no wardrobe, hangers, drawers or anywhere to put your belonging. Lamp beside the bed had no socket, extention lead ran across the floor to the tv. if you wanted to sit on the toilet you had to squash your way around the sink. The only nice thing about is was the bed which was really comforatable but overall I would never stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Building Site.”
Reviews.Author: sinead28
Reviews.Content: Booked a 4 star room, was not ready on arrival, given a 3 star room, on 3rd floor, lift not working, no facilities in room, no where in room to put your belongings.....Toilet in room 322 not practical at all, it is only suitable for people with no legs!!! Overall very bad experience of this hotel, would not stay there again. Hotel when we stayed there was like a building site. Stayed during early December 2011

Reviews.Title: “Fashion and design in this hotel with rooms dressed like models”
Reviews.Author: Crazy_dutchguy
Reviews.Content: Hotel the Exchange is a wonderful new design hotel by the people behind the Lloyd hotel & cultural embassy. I was excited to be invited to the opening ceremony, as vogue france already named this as a must-see hotel. Now you have to be a bit adventurous, as this is by no means a standard hotel. Every room is "dressed as if it was a model" by fashion designers. Located in the heart of the city on the Damrak street, which is lined with souvenir & kebab stores this fashionable hotel could just be what the neighborhood needs. Some 5star rooms have balconies with a view of the city and the stock exchange the hotel is named after. The hotel also contains a restaurant that reminds me of a hip NY style deli, and a design store with gifts by Dutch designers. I loved it! Location is great and all the staff was very friendly. The hotel does have many small staircases as it is in a historical building, so I'm glad I travelled light. Go and stay here if your in Amsterdam!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderfull new hotel at top location”
Reviews.Author: Kees63
Reviews.Content: This brand new design hotel is a must see. Rooms are very original. We stayed at a 4 star room and enjoyed our stay very much. There was very much attention to the design. Very original. People at the reception are very kind. It was 2 minute walk to Central Station and a 1 minute walk to Dam square. Defintely come back.

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel The Exchange
HotelInfo.Address: Damrak 50, Amsterdam 1012 LL, The Netherlands
